intro: Paepalanthus pubescens var. longepilosus, commonly known as the long-hair puya, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and dense, hairy foliage. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences with brightly colored bracts that attract pollinators. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
